cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 280 miles ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across the eastern Gulf toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then inland across Mississippi and Arkansas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Mississippi–Alabama border (around Dauphin Island / Mouth of the Pearl River)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch west of Shell Beach to the Mouth of the Mississippi River and east of Dauphin Island to Navarre, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning west of the Mouth of the Pearl River to east of Morgan City, LA (including Lake Pontchartrain & Lake Maurepas); Hurricane Warning Mouth of the Pearl River to the AL-FL border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from eastern Louisiana through Mississippi, Alabama and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts up to tropical-storm force (around 40 mph) possible, overall likelihood low (~11%)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – inland port, no direct surge threat
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated 12" totals possible, creating flash-flood potential in the Baton Rouge area
weather_observation.other_hazards: Localized river rises, urban flooding, and isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands may disrupt port and ground transport operations
